articles.title: Why England need good ODI year to avoid possible World Cup nightmare
articles.summary: England return to one-day international action again Sri Lanka this week, knowing another poor ODI year could put them at risk of embarrassingly missing out on automatic qualification for the 2027 World Cup.

articles.title: Titans Reportedly Set To Hire Robert Saleh As Next Head Coach
articles.summary: Another AFC head coaching vacancy has been filled, albeit not officially. Multiple NFL insiders, including ESPN’s Adam Schefter, are reporting that the Tennessee Titans and Robert Saleh are close to finalizing a deal that will make Saleh the franchise’s next head coach. Saleh began his NFL coaching journey in 2005 as a defensive intern with […]

articles.title: Jamie Carragher names the four managers Man United should target - and their most likely appointment - as he reveals why Michael Carrick should NOT be their next permanent boss
articles.summary: Former United midfielder Michael Carrick is in interim charge until the end of the season at Old Trafford, and oversaw a 2-0 win over Manchester City in the local derby at the weekend.

articles.title: Too many loopholes: How poor fielding, middle-overs failures triggered India's series loss
articles.summary: India's recent series losses, particularly against an inexperienced New Zealand, have intensified scrutiny on head coach Gautam Gambhir. Despite a Champions Trophy win, the team has faltered in Test and ODI formats, raising questions ahead of the T20 World Cup. Gambhir's tenure has seen mixed results, with some strategic decisions proving beneficial.
articles.author: Gaurav Gupta

articles.title: Kalis leads Dutch to seven-run win over Scotland
articles.summary: Scotland get off to a losing start at the Women's T20 World Cup Global Qualifier, with a score of 87 not out from Sterre Kalis leading the Netherlands to a seven-run victory in Nepal.

articles.title: 1st T20I: Not Iyer! India captain reveals Tilak's replacement in playing XI
articles.summary: India captain Suryakumar Yadav said Ishan Kishan will bat at No. 3 ahead of Shreyas Iyer in the New Zealand T20 series as he is part of India’s T20 World Cup squad and a like-for-like replacement for injured Tilak Varma. Iyer will be considered at No. 5. Suryakumar stressed flexibility in batting roles and prioritised team success over individual form.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: Bangladesh T20 World Cup 2026 Participation Controversy, LIVE Updates: Pakistan Reveal 'Boycott' Stance After Bangladesh's Fiery Response To ICC
articles.summary: Bangladesh T20 World Cup Controversy LIVE Updates | Cricket News

articles.title: 'Fully legal!' - Cadillac chief backs Ferrari amid engine controversy
articles.summary: Cadillac chief Graeme Lowdon says he is happy that Ferrari have provided his team with a "fully legal engine" amid a developing controversy over the new power units for the 2026 Formula 1 season.

articles.title: 'Ball daal apna chup chap aur peeche ja': Rohit Sharma to Kuldeep Yadav
articles.summary: Former captain Rohit Sharma offered advice to spinner Kuldeep Yadav for the upcoming T20 World Cup. Sharma suggested Yadav focus on his bowling and refrain from frequent appeals. This comes as the team considers selection between Yadav and Varun Chakaravarthy. Yadav is part of India's squad for the T20 World Cup.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: BCCI plans central contract overhaul as Virat, Rohit likely to drop from top tier
articles.summary: The BCCI is considering a major overhaul of its central contracts, potentially scrapping the Grade A+ category. This move could see senior players like Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, now focusing on ODIs, placed in Grade B. The proposed three-tier system aims to align contracts with workload and format involvement.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: T20 WC: Key Pak bowler to miss; PCB decides to go in different direction
articles.summary: Pakistan may drop fast bowler Haris Rauf from their ICC T20 World Cup 2026 plans, according to reports. Influenced by head coach Mike Hesson, the decision follows Rauf’s absence from recent T20 internationals since the 2025 Asia Cup, as selectors assess other bowling options despite his strong Big Bash League form.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: ‘Confidence takes a hit’: Ashwin flags Kuldeep’s WC challenge after NZ series
articles.summary: Ravichandran Ashwin expressed concern over Kuldeep Yadav's confidence ahead of the T20 World Cup following a challenging ODI series against New Zealand. Ashwin urged Kuldeep to experiment more against in-form batters like Daryl Mitchell, who exploited the spinner's predictability. He also suggested both Indian spinners need to expand their game creatively.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: Want Daryl to replicate his ODI performance in T20Is: Santner
articles.summary: New Zealand captain Mitchell Santner is confident Daryl Mitchell will translate his stellar ODI form into the T20 series against India. Mitchell's recent centuries against the hosts highlight his prowess, and Santner believes he can control the middle overs. This tour is crucial preparation for the upcoming T20 World Cup, offering valuable experience against a top team in familiar conditions.
articles.author: TOI Sports Desk

articles.title: 'We will not accept': Bangladesh rejects ICC's 'unreasonable' conditions
articles.summary: Bangladesh has rejected "unreasonable conditions" from the ICC for the T20 World Cup 2026 in India, citing venue concerns and the exclusion of Mustafizur Rahman from the IPL. Despite talks, Bangladesh's participation remains uncertain as the ICC insists on the original schedule, assuring security.

articles.title: 'Want to play like him': Pandya's special message leaves RCB player emotional
articles.summary: Hardik Pandya sent a special video message to RCB's Gautami Naik after her match-winning fifty in the WPL. Naik, who considers Pandya her idol, was overjoyed by the gesture. Pandya congratulated her on her maiden half-century and urged her to stay disciplined and enjoy the game. RCB continued their winning streak, remaining unbeaten.
